network_overview: The capture primarily contains low-rate UDP traffic (notably UDP/1701) over a ~945s window, with only a single correlated "GTP-U Tunnel" packet observed (60 bytes) and no TEIDs extracted. A single deep-transaction entry shows a GTPv2-C message (GTP-Msg-0x1a) with TEID 0x00000000 and no cause/response recorded, so service outcome and any 3GPP failure scenario cannot be confirmed from this evidence.

observations.finding: Multiple long-duration, low packet-rate UDP flows using source/destination port 1701 dominate the top flows (e.g., 301 packets over ~931.83s; 66 packets over ~938.92s), consistent with periodic/keepalive-like behavior rather than high-throughput payload in this capture.

Although capture statistics list detected protocols as UDP and GTP-U, the Deep Transactions sample explicitly includes a GTPv2-C message; this indicates either partial decoding/classification or mixed traffic in the dataset, but there is insufficient follow-up signaling in the provided evidence to determine procedure outcome.
observations.evidence: Deep Transactions: frame 544, protocol=GTPv2-C, message_type=GTP-Msg-0x1a, _src=10.47.81.138, _dst=10.47.81.124, teid=0x00000000

observations.finding: No GTP tunnels/TEIDs are observable in the summary (GTP Tunnels: 0; unique_teids: 0), limiting any user-plane bearer validation from this capture point.
observations.evidence: Capture stats: GTP Tunnels=0; Correlated Sessions: "GTP-U Tunnel" total_packets=1 total_bytes=60 teids=[] unique_teids=0

observations.finding: A single attempt of GTP-Msg-0x1a is recorded with 0% success rate and no latency/cause details, so a standards-based failure pattern cannot be matched.
observations.evidence: PROCEDURE KPIs: "GTP-Msg-0x1a": attempts=1, success_rate=0.0, avg_latency_ms=0, top_causes={}

root_causes.issue: Inconclusive control/user-plane outcome due to insufficient GTP procedure visibility
root_causes.description: The only explicit 3GPP control indication in the provided evidence is a single GTPv2-C message (GTP-Msg-0x1a) at frame 544 with TEID 0x00000000 and no cause/result shown. Additionally, the capture summary indicates zero GTP tunnels and zero unique TEIDs, with only one small correlated GTP-U tunnel packet. With no observed response/error/cause fields and no tunnel identifiers, the specific network-side failure (if any) cannot be proven at packet level from this dataset.
root_causes.impact: Cannot determine whether any session establishment/modification succeeded or failed, and cannot correlate to a specific bearer/tunnel for user-plane validation.
root_causes.confidence_justification: High confidence that the dataset lacks the required packet-level elements (responses/cause/TEIDs) to establish a definitive root cause; this is directly supported by the summaries (GTP tunnels=0, unique_teids=0) and the lone GTPv2-C message with null cause.
evidence_refs: Deep transaction: frame_number=544, timestamp=1660756057.6422484, protocol=GTPv2-C, message_type=GTP-Msg-0x1a, teid=0x00000000, cause=null, _src=10.47.81.138, _dst=10.47.81.124
Capture stats: GTP Tunnels=0; Diameter Sessions=0
Correlated Sessions: "GTP-U Tunnel" total_packets=1 total_bytes=60 teids=[] unique_teids=0

inconclusive_aspects.aspect: Whether GTP-Msg-0x1a succeeded or failed (and any specific 3GPP cause)
inconclusive_aspects.reason: No corresponding response message, cause IE, or error code is provided for the GTPv2-C transaction; KPI shows success_rate=0.0 but without the packet-level reject/cause evidence required to prove a standardized failure scenario.
inconclusive_aspects.additional_capture_needed: Capture the full bidirectional exchange around frame 544 including any GTPv2-C responses and cause IEs, and include enough context to correlate request/response (sequence/transaction identifiers as available).

inconclusive_aspects.reason: No TEIDs are observable (unique_teids=0) and only 1 packet is attributed to a GTP-U tunnel, preventing validation of sustained user-plane forwarding for any subscriber session.
inconclusive_aspects.additional_capture_needed: User-plane capture that includes sustained GTP-U traffic with decodable TEIDs and inner IP payload, or a capture location where TEID-bearing packets are visible end-to-end.

inconclusive_aspects.reason: No calls, no SDP media, and no RTP quality metrics are present in the provided evidence; therefore media behavior is not observable in this dataset.
inconclusive_aspects.additional_capture_needed: A capture that includes the relevant media/signaling streams (if applicable) and accompanying quality metrics at the same observation point/time window.

inconclusive_aspects.aspect: Precise identification of the UDP/1701 application/protocol and its role
inconclusive_aspects.reason: Only UDP flow metadata (ports, packet counts, timing) is provided; no explicit higher-layer protocol decoding is included in the evidence.
inconclusive_aspects.additional_capture_needed: Packet-level decode of the UDP/1701 payload (dissector output/fields) or capture with protocol dissection enabled for the relevant application over UDP/1701.

recommendations.action: Collect a bidirectional capture around the GTPv2-C event (frame 544) to include the corresponding response and any cause/result fields.
recommendations.rationale: The current evidence includes only a single GTPv2-C message with cause=null; without the response/cause, no 3GPP failure pattern can be proven.

recommendations.action: Enable/retain full protocol dissection outputs for observed UDP flows (especially UDP/1701) to identify the application-layer messages and correlate them with any network procedures.
recommendations.rationale: Top flows are dominated by UDP/1701 with keepalive-like rates, but the capture evidence does not include decoded message types/fields to support root-cause attribution.

recommendations.action: If the intent is user-plane verification, capture sufficient continuous user-plane traffic so TEIDs and tunnel identifiers are observable and correlate to sessions.
recommendations.rationale: Summary shows GTP tunnels=0 and unique_teids=0 with only a single small GTP-U-attributed packet, which is insufficient to validate bearer establishment or forwarding.

session_analysis.signaling_health: Not determinable from the provided evidence. A single GTPv2-C message (GTP-Msg-0x1a) is shown without a response/cause; no other signaling protocols are evidenced here.
session_analysis.user_plane_health: User-plane tunnel health is not verifiable: only one GTP-U tunnel packet is correlated (60 bytes) and no TEIDs are extracted (unique_teids=0).
session_analysis.voice_quality: Not observable from this capture (no calls, no SDP media, no RTP metrics in evidence).
session_analysis.cross_plane_correlation: Not possible with provided data because there are no session identifiers (no subscriber identities, no TEIDs) to correlate signaling events with user-plane flows.
